displaytitle: Design for the Façade of Casa Orsi
medium: Pen and brown ink and brush and brown and yellow-brown wash heightened with white gouache over black chalk, on rust-brown prepared laid paper
creditline: Gift of Frank Jewett Mather Jr.
markings: Watermark: Anchor in a circle (Briquet 552, Reggio Emilia 1566)
inscribed:
Inscribed recto, lower left, in black ink: Lelio de
Novelare; lower right, in black ink: J.C.R.; inscribed
verso, center, in black next to a paraph: Clxxy;
upper center, in red pencil: iii5

titles.title: Design for the Façade of Casa Orsi

texts.textentryhtml: This design, for the facade of one of the Orsi family homes in Novellara or Reggio Emilia, bears an old inscription with the artist’s name in the lower left corner, made by a previous owner. Bolstering this attribution is the presence of a watermark that depicts an anchor in a circle, which is documented on paper produced in Reggio Emilia in 1566; such paper would have been readily available to the artist.<?xml:namespace prefix = "o" ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p>

Desneux de la Noue, Paris, paraph
(L. 3014) verso, center, in black; E. Jabach, script,
verso, upper center, in red; Pierre Crozat (?);
Sir John Charles Robinson, London, script
(L. 1433) recto, lower right, in black ink; Frank
Jewett Mather Jr., stamp (L. 1853a) recto, lower
left, in black.

caption: Lelio Orsi (Italian, 1508–1587), Design for the Façade of Casa Orsi, ca. 1570s. Pen and brown ink and brush and brown and yellow-brown wash heightened with white gouache over black chalk, on rust-brown prepared laid paper; 23.8 × 31.8 cm, 40.5 × 53.2 × 2.9 cm (frame). Gift of Frank Jewett Mather Jr. (x1947-14)
